title: Addis Ababa Public Transport Accessibility Analysis
description: Comprehensive accessibility analysis for Ethiopia's capital covering 4.5M+ residents. Analysis includes minibus taxis (20+ routes), BRT system, and city buses. Average travel time: 45 mins, Mode share: 60% minibus, 25% walking, 15% private.

title: Nairobi Public Transport Accessibility Analysis
description: Accessibility study for Kenya's capital serving 4.4M+ people. Transport modes: Matatus (informal buses), BRT, commuter rail. Average travel time: 52 mins, Mode share: 55% matatus, 20% walking, 15% boda-boda.

title: Kampala Public Transport Accessibility Analysis
description: Transit analysis for Uganda's capital with 1.7M+ population. Primary modes: Matatus, boda-bodas (motorcycle taxis), walking. Average travel time: 48 mins, Mode share: 50% matatus, 30% boda-boda, 20% walking.

title: Kigali Public Transport Accessibility Analysis
description: Transit analysis for Rwanda's capital (1.3M+ population). Modern bus system with tap-in/tap-out. Average travel time: 35 mins, Mode share: 60% buses, 25% motorcycle taxis, 15% walking. Best-in-class transit system.

title: Accra Public Transport Accessibility Analysis
description: Accessibility study for Ghana's capital (2.5M+ residents). Modes: Trotro (minibuses), metro buses, taxis. Average travel time: 54 mins, Mode share: 55% trotro, 20% metro bus, 15% walking, 10% taxi.

title: Abidjan Public Transport Accessibility Analysis
description: Transit analysis for CÃ´te d'Ivoire's economic capital (4.7M+ metro area). Transport: Gbakas, buses, taxis. Average travel time: 56 mins, Mode share: 50% gbakas, 25% buses, 15% walking, 10% taxi.

title: Bamako Public Transport Accessibility Analysis
description: Transit analysis for Mali's capital (2.5M+ residents). Primary modes: Sotrama (minibuses), buses, motorcycle taxis. Average travel time: 46 mins, Mode share: 60% sotrama, 20% walking, 15% motorcycle.

title: Freetown Public Transport Accessibility Analysis
description: Transit analysis for Sierra Leone's capital (1.2M+ population). Modes: Poda-podas (minibuses), okadas (motorcycle taxis), ferries. Average travel time: 48 mins, Mode share: 50% poda-poda, 25% okada, 20% walking.

title: Kumasi Public Transport Accessibility Analysis
description: Accessibility study for Ghana's second-largest city (3.3M+ metro area). Primary modes: Trotro (minibuses), metro buses, taxis. Average travel time: 50 mins, Mode share: 60% trotro, 20% metro bus, 15% walking, 5% taxi.

title: Alexandria Public Transport Accessibility Analysis
description: Comprehensive study for Egypt's second-largest city (5.2M+ residents). Transport modes: Trams, buses, microbuses, taxis. Average travel time: 55 mins, Mode share: 40% microbus, 25% tram, 20% bus, 15% taxi.

title: Cairo Public Transport Accessibility Analysis
description: Transit analysis for Egypt's capital and Africa's largest city (21M+ metro area). Modes: Metro, buses, microbuses, taxis. Average travel time: 68 mins, Mode share: 35% microbus, 30% metro, 20% bus, 15% taxi.

title: Tetouan Public Transport Accessibility Analysis
description: Accessibility study for Morocco's northern city (380K+ population). Transport modes: Grand taxis, petits taxis, buses. Average travel time: 32 mins, Mode share: 45% grand taxi, 30% petit taxi, 20% bus, 5% walking.

title: Douala Public Transport Accessibility Analysis
description: Transit analysis for Cameroon's largest city (3.7M+ metro population). Primary modes: Bendskin (motorcycle taxis), minibuses, shared taxis. Average travel time: 54 mins, Mode share: 50% bendskin, 30% minibus, 20% taxi.

title: Kinshasa Public Transport Accessibility Analysis
description: Comprehensive study for DRC's capital (15M+ metro population). Transport modes: Esprit de Mort (minibuses), motorcycle taxis, boats. Average travel time: 75 mins, Mode share: 50% minibus, 25% motorcycle, 20% walking, 5% boat.

title: Harare Public Transport Accessibility Analysis
description: Transit analysis for Zimbabwe's capital (1.5M+ population). Modes: Kombis (minibuses), ZUPCO buses, shared taxis. Average travel time: 46 mins, Mode share: 60% kombi, 25% ZUPCO bus, 15% walking.

title: Lusaka Public Transport Accessibility Analysis
description: Accessibility study for Zambia's capital (2.5M+ metro area). Primary modes: Minibuses, shared taxis. Average travel time: 48 mins, Mode share: 65% minibus, 20% shared taxi, 15% walking.

title: Mini Grid Planing for a rural village
description: Power gird planing made for  a ruler city located in Afghanistan to extend the national grid system to give access to electricity

title: The National Intercity Public Route Network Map of Ethiopia
description: This is was one of the projects that I was fully responsible to collect,process and produced the map for the Federal Transport Authority of Ethiopia under the supervision of the Ministry of Transport

title: Mini Bus Taxi Network - The Digital Mapping of Addis Ababa's Public Transport Network
description: Digitized the road network of Addis Ababa including the Blue taxis, Sheger and Anbessa Bus routes with QGIS and Python in collaboration with World Resources Institute, Addis Ababa Roads Transport Authority and Addis Ababa University.

title: Anbesa City Bus Network - The Digital Mapping of Addis Ababa's Public Transport Network
description: Digitized the road network of Addis Ababa including the Blue taxis, Sheger and Anbessa Bus routes with QGIS and Python in collaboration with World Resources Institute, Addis Ababa Roads Transport Authority and Addis Ababa University.

title: Sheger City Bus Network - The Digital Mapping of Addis Ababa's Public Transport Network
description: Digitized the road network of Addis Ababa including the Blue taxis, Sheger and Anbessa Bus routes with QGIS and Python in collaboration with World Resources Institute, Addis Ababa Roads Transport Authority and Addis Ababa University.
